channel.title: [PI] Getting Server Online
channel.description:
This is my first PI server I have started to work on.
So I just downloaded Exion as my base. In his post he said to change the IP all you need to do is going into client>client.java and find [code=java]server = "0.0.0.0"[/code] Then change that to your IP. Although I did this and now I can't connect. Is there something server sided I need to do aswell? I went into my server files and searched "0.0.0.0", "127.0.0.1", "localhost" and nothing showed up. So currently I have been running the server on the IP "0.0.0.0".
If anyone has had this problem with Exion before or could point me in the right direction as to what I need to do that would be great.

item.title: [PI] Getting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @c_o_l_d c o l d
item.description:
@c_o_l_d wrote:

tehjamdude:

So are you saying that you can’t find “server = 0.0.0.0”, or that you can’t change it?

I have found it and I have changed it, but when I change it to my no-ip it won’t let me log in. So i left it as" 0.0.0.0".

Read full topic

item.description:
@c_o_l_d wrote:

This is my first PI server I have started to work on.

So I just downloaded Exion as my base. In his post he said to change the IP all you need to do is going into client>client.java and find server = "0.0.0.0" Then change that to your IP. Although I did this and now I can’t connect. Is there something server sided I need to do aswell? I went into my server files and searched “0.0.0.0”, “127.0.0.1”, “localhost” and nothing showed up. So currently I have been running the server on the IP “0.0.0.0”.

If anyone has had this problem with Exion before or could point me in the right direction as to what I need to do that would be great.
